intro: Benthamia nigrovaginata, commonly known as the black-vagina benthamia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive dark purple to blackish calyces that enclose the flower buds. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Benthamia nigrovaginata is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
